column2: Since then, we’ve had zero insurance claims — not a one. This year — instead of reminding us that insurance payment due — we got a notice that we missed a payment and our policy was getting cancelled. Anyway, the insurance adjuster came out and identified several areas in need of repair.
column4: My 89-year-old mom’s home is in serious disrepair, and she’s severely ill. Can we skip buying her home insurance?

column2: A look back at the 1970s and 1980s is a reminder of how painful soaring prices can be. Retirees, investors, and homeowners all have something to lose.
column4: Inflation Is a Real Problem. Remember the 1970s and 1980s.
